title: (x) A casual, irregular font needed - various {gang}
content:
Hola typophiles,   
I need a font in the same spirit of "39 Smooth", but with a complete charset since this font doesnt have accents ![:-(](http://web.archive.org/web/20050825185008im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/sad.gif)   
Can you please help me finding one?   
   
I was using 39 Smooth in the titles for a children book.   
   
 ![39 smooth](http://web.archive.org/web/20050825185008im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/40715.jpg)   
   
This sample is "39 Smooth" by Lauren Ashpole   
 [http://eksten.net/webgraphix/fonts/09/39smooth.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20050825185008/http:/eksten.net/webgraphix/fonts/09/39smooth.html)   
   
Thx.   
Christian N.
author: chn

comments.content: You could try some of the [House Industries](http://web.archive.org/web/20050825185008/http:/houseind.com/house.php?kit=GENCOL-FO&sub=view) general collection such as Randumhouse, doghouse, clubhouse, rougthouse.

You could see the samples in [Part 14 (Strange, Distressed Scripts)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050825185008/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script14Pg1.html) or [Part 12 (Childish Lettering)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050825185008/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script12Pg1.html) of the Script Font ID Guide for ideas. The Script Font Reference List (linked on each page of the Guide) will tell you where they come from so you can check out the ones you think are candidates.
If you think this is the right font, why don't you create the missing accents?

Thx for the help typophiles!   
Adriano, i thought about that, but i'm in a hurry to deliver this, so i needed a replacement font.
